Class TimeRange

java.lang.Object
common.TimeRange
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TimeRange extends Object implements Serializable
Utility class representing a specific time interval (e.g., Opening Hours). This class is crucial for validating if a requested reservation falls within the operational hours of the restaurant. *

Implemented as Serializable to allow cross-network transfer between Client and Server via OCSF.

* @author Software Engineering Student
Version:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeRange

      public TimeRange(String openTime, String closeTime)
      Constructs a TimeRange with designated start and end points. * @param openTime Opening time string (e.g., "08:00").
      Parameters:
      closeTime - Closing time string (e.g., "22:00").

  • Method Details

    • isWithinRange

      public boolean isWithinRange(String timeStr)
      Core Algorithm: Determines if a given time string falls within this defined range. This method is designed to handle three distinct logical scenarios: 1. Closed: When open and close times are identical (e.g., 00:00 to 00:00). 2. Standard ranges: (e.g., 08:00 to 22:00). 3. Midnight-crossing ranges: (e.g., 22:00 to 02:00).
      Parameters:
      timeStr - The time to check in "HH:mm" format.
      Returns:
      true if the time is within the range (inclusive), false otherwise.

    • getOpenTime

      public String getOpenTime()
      Returns:
      The starting time of this range.

    • getCloseTime

      public String getCloseTime()
      Returns:
      The ending time of this range.
